title: The Hobbit, Mamma Mia, The Beach inspire wanderlust
text:
The Hobbit, Mamma Mia, The Beach inspire wanderlust Last updated 05:00, September 25 2015 
Peter Jackson during shooting The Hobbit on the Pelorus River near Nelson. 
Ever seen a film and thought, 'I've got to go there one day'? You're not alone, according to a recent survey. A survey, carried out by Leger Holidays , found that 70 per cent of travellers could pinpoint a specific moment that triggered desire to book a holiday. The Daily Mail reported that over a quarter of those surveyed cited movies and books as their main inspiration. Among the literary works and films mentioned specifically were Alex Garland's The Beach - filmed in Ko Phi Phi Island in Thailand, Mamma Mia - filmed in the Greek islands and The Hobbit movies - filmed in New Zealand. 
  
A scene from Mamma Mia via GIPHY In total 17 per cent said Mamma Mia would prompt feelings of wanderlust, with 16 per cent coveting the scenery made famous by Peter Jackson's The Hobbit . A scene from The Hobbit via GIPHY Twenty-nine per cent of respondents said reading The Beach inspired them to book a Thailand holiday. Leonardo di Caprio in The Beach via GIPHY Another main driver was social media, with 17 per cent booking a holiday after seeing online updates from friends and family.
